issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We recently updated to SDK and LiveView 1.4.2 and noticed that LiveView does not work (= does not launch Simulator) anymore. Log:
{code}
[TRACE] ** BUILD SUCCEEDED **
[INFO]  Finished building the application in 1m 7s 303ms
[LiveView] version 1.4.2
[LiveView] Alloy project monitor started
[LiveView] File Server Started on 0.0.0.0:8324
[LiveView] Event Server Started on 0.0.0.0:8323
{code}
The project is already shared with the Appc team, so it can be reproduced there.
fields.summary: TiAPI: LiveView not working on SDK 8+

comments.body:
I can't reproduce this issue. Me and 2 other people here (3 separate machines) are able to launch the iOS Simulator and Android emulator via LiveView 1.4.2 just fine. We've done it via the CLIL (v7.0.9) and via Appcelerator Studio.

Is this just a simulator/emulator launch issue for you?
If you launch the simulator/emulator yourself, is LiveView able to function from then on?
I'm going to close this as cannot reproduce, based off the error logs it looks very similar to when a global install of liveview and a local install of liveview are fighting, nothing project specific
